message: “But we are like everywhere else in the fact that there are always going to be other people wanting to take advantage of people, vulnerable people,” she said. “Our job as citizens in the community is to be aware. Our job as human beings is to protect.”

data.description: Mirror Ministries is in the final three days of a crowdfunding campaign to raise $10,000 to help pay for the salary of its second human trafficking advocate. The faith-based organization provides…
data.title: Public outreach aimed at aiding sex-trafficking survivors
